Using Keyboard Shortcuts

Contents | Index

You can use key sequences to invoke commands and to navigate in your Siebel application. Keyboard shortcuts are available in two modes: basic and extended.

  • In basic mode, you can only use key sequences that are not used by the Web browser in which the Siebel application runs, and you cannot use special keys in the sequences (such as function and arrow keys).
  • In extended mode, there are no limitations on the keys used to establish key sequences. This is the default mode. Extended keyboard shortcuts are not available in standard-interactivity mode.

A key sequence available in basic mode is also available in extended mode.

Keyboard shortcuts can be grouped into the following categories:

Data Management

Record Navigation

Query Management

General Navigation

Online Help

Layout Management

Communication Management

Application Functions


Note: The keyboard shortcuts described in this section come with the Siebel application provided by Oracle. If your Siebel administrator has reconfigured these shortcuts, your keyboard shortcuts will be different. Contact your Siebel administrator if you encounter any difficulties using your shortcuts.

See Also

Understanding the User Interface


Data Management


Action Basic Mode Extended Mode Menu Option
and/or Button
New record CTRL + ALT + N CTRL + N Edit > New Record
New record using Quick Fill template CTRL + K   None
New record using last used Quick Fill template CTRL + J   None
Apply Quick Fill template to record CTRL + Q   None
Copy record CTRL + ALT + C CTRL + B Edit > Copy Record
Save record CTRL + SHIFT + S CTRL + S Edit > Save Record
Delete record CTRL + ALT + D CTRL + D Edit > Delete Record
Undo record CTRL + ALT + U
- or -
ESC		 CTRL + U
- or -
ESC		 Edit > Undo Record
Select All CTRL + ALT + A CTRL + A Edit > Select All
Invoke selection dialog box CTRL + ALT + P F2 or down arrow Select button
Open the calendar control CTRL + ALT + P F2 or down arrow Calendar button
Open the calculator control CTRL + ALT + P F2 or down arrow Calculator button
Open a drop-down list CTRL + ALT + P F2 or down arrow None

Save and close the calendar control

CTRL + 1   None

Save and close the calculator control

CTRL + 1   None

Close the calendar control without saving

 CTRL + 2   None

Close the calculator control without saving

CTRL + 2   None

Action Basic Mode Extended Mode Menu Option
and/or Button
Drill down into record

Record navigation buttons
Next record CTRL + SHIFT + . CTRL + down arrow Navigate > Next Record

Vertical scroll bars
